Russia’s corrupt dictator will pay an enormous price for this attack, as will his oligarchs and other enablers in Russia and throughout the globe.

Putin has attacked a peaceful, democratic nation to expand his corrupt power. This warrantless aggression demands a swift and forceful response from the NATO alliance. It is an enormous test of our resolve – but one I expect we will pass.
The pressure on Putin is through his oligarchs. We should pound them.

Marcus calls out strategic judicial activism from right-wing plants in the court, and does it well.

Great call by the administration. We ignore the social cost of carbon at our own peril - this was the right move.

We should pause fossil fuel licenses, permits and leases while this gets resolved. As courts have said, we may not be sure what the social cost of carbon emissions is, but we know it isn’t zero.

Excellent piece by Anne Applebaum, who was part of our “Codel McCain” to the Munich Security Conference.

With subsidies for polluting industries (that pay politicians to subsidize them), “humanity is financing its own extinction.”

Drug traffickers, kleptocrats, and other bad actors pull elaborate tricks to stow their loot behind American rule of law. My bipartisan bill with @ChuckGrassley arms law enforcement with tools to tackle new methods of money laundering and counterfeiting.

A business deal as shady as it is unsurprising.

Thinking of the victims and families whose lives were forever changed by the Station Nightclub fire. Hard to believe it’s been 19 years since that dark night.

Thank goodness for courts — judge denies Trump effort to wriggle away from accountability for January 6 assault on the Capitol.

Good RI news: @USMint is releasing a $1 coin honoring our Ocean State history of shipbuilding, innovation, and craftsmanship. Nice to see Nathaniel Herreshoff’s Reliance celebrated, over a century after she won the America’s Cup. Visit Bristol’s Herreshoff Museum to learn more! https://t.co/0rAb9BgdM6

President Zelensky: “No matter what, we are going to protect our beautiful land.” https://t.co/R1n3ODbXpm
Great Munich Security Conference speech by Vice President Harris as Russian invasion of Ukraine looms.  “Our strength must not be underestimated.”

Joined @JohnKerry for a climate diplomacy panel today in Munich to discuss a path forward for carbon pricing. We can get this done, but corporate America has to drop the obstruction and pitch in. https://t.co/6MxebfV1HE
.@POTUS called in to Munich yesterday to thank the delegation for standing together in support of the transatlantic alliance – Democrats and Republicans, House and Senate.

As attacks on reproductive freedom continue, the Senate teed up a vote on the Women’s Health Protection Act. 

With the Supreme Court aiming torpedoes at Roe, it’s more important than ever to safeguard abortion rights.

Honored to attend John McCain Dissertation Award Ceremony tonight. Sen. McCain helped make the Munich Security Conference what it is today, and led the U.S. Congressional Delegation to Germany for many years. His passion for diplomacy lives on.

Recent attacks on the next Supreme Court nominee, launched by the same right-wing donor interests that captured the Court under President Trump, are an attempt to distract from their own dark-money operation. My new op-ed exposes the scheme:
https://t.co/PdHSVzPwpv

Long but well done overview of extent of fossil fuel disinformation operation, and PR firm complicity.  Political dark money is a whole separate department.   
https://t.co/tIfh7pPYWk

Kleptocrats and criminals thrive in secrecy, and America has a duty to expose them. Today in Munich, I shared the progress we’ve made in the U.S. and called for transparency across all sectors. https://t.co/6nxLrTrWpy

The Ocean State’s seafood industry was hit hard early in the pandemic and still faces lingering challenges. This federal funding will help hardworking local fishermen keep delivering some of the world’s best seafood for Rhode Islanders to enjoy. https://t.co/5AMtLgxIWf

As Russia continues to escalate this crisis, I am leading a U.S. Congressional Delegation to Munich to stand with our allies that have helped ensure peace in Europe since WWII. I hope to find common ground on climate issues & work to rein in international corruption.

When big Republican donor interests come before the Court, they win - it looks like every time. It’s currently at more than 80 to 0. 

When the evidence is bad, what do you do? You blow smoke.

Being “tough on crime” doesn’t mean convicting innocent people. If we denounce those working to keep our justice system fair, criminals will walk free while the wrongly-convicted sit in prison. https://t.co/b7NxmB90CS

The other thing that changed after 2008 was Republican justices’ 2010 Citizens United decision, unleashing unlimited and hidden fossil fuel money into politics, buying Republican Party, and ending climate bipartisanship. #ReckoningWillCome
https://t.co/igq4rbGvV8

The other side of the story is how expertly, graciously and fearlessly Ms. Morrison responded to them — sort of like a super-smart kindergarten teacher dealing with unruly boys. She never batted an eye; they never laid a glove. Great job her.
https://t.co/uVBaYHCt3z

Wonderful remembrances of a lovely man. And a great American lawyer. RIP, Walter.
https://t.co/shAGsOR0z0

One more foot of sea level rise coming, and it accelerates after that. Check out StormTools to see what it does to our RI map.

Dark money spending has rigged our politics for big secretive donors, and the American people are sick of it. Voters, not special interests, should be the loudest voices in the room.
An investment in quality child care is an investment in America’s future. Let’s get that done and give working families a boost.
The results of the supernarrow straw they’ve all been drawn through have been terrible for the Court.

This one’s already underway, and we’ll get the best nominee for the job, but for next vacancy, he’s right. When O’Connor left, it was first Supreme Court in history with no election experience.
 https://t.co/JsOHcWQtK5
While people around the world battle demand surges and supply-chain issues, multinational corporations are jacking up prices, boosting CEO pay, and making life hard for consumers. That’s just wrong.

This is really about Raskin, and it’s driven by fossil fuel polluters, for whom too many colleagues are mere minions.
https://t.co/oSwuB41I1D
.@RIAudubon has tips on how to view this beautiful visitor without causing undue stress or harm. See: https://t.co/aOxlbhcAnS

Fossil fuel fingers creep in everywhere. 
https://t.co/BE19HPAQGP
It’s not in the Constitution, by the way. Corporate political power was slowly and steadily invented and grown by Republicans on the Supreme Court.

Open question why corporate forces should have controlling clout in Congress; so long as they do, they should have some modicum of public responsibility; climate effort proves that they don’t. We should reconsider letting them have that clout when it’s used for evil.

This overlooks another fact: corporate politics/lobbying remains net OPPOSED to climate legislation. No safe pathway on climate without a serious bill; no net corporate support (near-zero individual corporate support) for serious bill; do the math.
https://t.co/F6Ta8m7rON

Thank goodness for courts.
 https://t.co/pF7hlIlR01

I’m pushing Treasury to swiftly & decisively end kleptocrats and criminals’ access to rule-of-law financial systems. Strong anti-money laundering measures protect our national security. 
https://t.co/BaNnpmeRau

Corrupt leaders who rob their own people shouldn’t be able to protect their loot using our laws and financial system. I’m fighting for more transparency and stronger penalties to make sure they can’t.

Driest since Charlemagne. Yet fossil fuel still obstructs, as do some politicians from the area (not the era).    
https://t.co/JMR8f02zgz

Out-of-state dark money organizations have spent the last year pushing voter suppression laws through state legislatures. 

Voters deserve to see the players behind this campaign, and my DISCLOSE Act would pull back the curtain.

Amicus briefs have become a Trojan Horse for special interests seeking to influence the Supreme Court, and big Republican donors keep on winning. My AMICUS Act would close this loophole and enforce real financial disclosures.
https://t.co/nO5F3J8S2c
Corporations that advertise sustainability should make sure their plans measure up. Too many belong to trade associations ignoring or fighting climate legislation. It’s time to commit.

But worst of all is that those companies spend zero political capital on climate effort in Congress: fossil fuel is up to its usual misdeeds; the rest of corporate America is still below net-zero on effort.
Lots of carbon offsets are bogus. There’s not enough integrity.  https://t.co/wW1C9pMz2t
Thanks to $22 million over five years from the bipartisan infrastructure law, it’s about to get a lot more convenient to drive an electric car around Rhode Island.
We must protect our democracy by restoring our Supreme Court to the impartial arbiter of constitutional outcomes it once was before right-wing capture.

I can bear sad witness to our “listless Democratic party” in face of “power grabs...to enshrine corporate prerogative as a first-order principle of constitutional rule.”
https://t.co/B1vltI56pL
We’ll all be thrilled to have you back, Ben Ray! https://t.co/hxc5pTLVgN

Hunting for hand-blown glass orbs has become a tradition on Block Island – it’s a great excuse to enjoy its beautiful coastal trail network. Here’s an interesting piece about the Rhode Islanders who make it all happen.  
https://t.co/oYivRJHzpT
Breton Point sunrise. https://t.co/HgK7Zl8gKa

I look forward to a prompt & respectful confirmation process for President Biden’s Supreme Court pick. The dark money organizations that captured the Court will attempt to disrupt the confirmation, but we’re prepared to push back very hard against that false pressure.
Less happy news: a friend is waiting for a medical procedure because hospitals are clogged with people who didn’t get vaccinated. Please get vaccinated and spare our hospitals.

The “truth telltale” of when you can start trusting Big Oil is when they come clean on their secret funding through the last decade of climate obstruction. Confession is good for the soul.

More than 150 yrs before the Armed Forces were integrated, the 1st Rhode Island Regiment fought valiantly for the nation's independence. Finally, our bipartisan legislation recognizes the Black & Indigenous men who enlisted with a Congressional Gold Medal. https://t.co/4kXXYSE0fN

It’s time to call out the fossil fuel industry’s dark money mischief. People don’t like being lied to, especially not by big, corrupt, polluting interests.
 
They’ve been lied to for decades, and they need to know that.

Trump Federalist Society (fossil-fuel approved) judge disapproves social cost of carbon. You cannot make this up. The rot runs deep.

Seniorest and juniorest Judiciary members in Roosevelt Room for SCOTUS meeting with Biden.

The SEC should require strong climate risk disclosures, including “crash protection” against these mega-risks.

Andre Mathis has more courtroom experience than Judge Walker, Judge Rao, and Justice Barrett combined when they took the bench. He is a highly qualified nominee for the Sixth Circuit, and partisan opposition can’t obscure that fact.
In politics, money corrupts, and dark money corrupts absolutely.

Glad to see my colleagues introduce a strong, bipartisan #VAWA reauthorization. I’ve long supported the Violence Against Women Act to protect victims of domestic violence and secure justice for survivors. It's time for Congress to step up, come together, and pass this bill.

More dirty fossil fuel dark-money mischief:  now getting stooges to say it’s “bias” to act on climate.  No shame. Sadly, Democratic countermeasures against this scheme are pathetic.
https://t.co/zQRj76waUS

Imagine a big, profitable corporation harms you & your family. You sue to cover hospital bills, but when you do, you discover the company that hurt you is somehow in bankruptcy and your claim won’t be addressed for months or years, if at all. Here’s how the scheme works. https://t.co/6WQGvSgTc3
As the Biden administration selects a nominee, the Scheme is shifting gears to attack her – before she’s even named. They’re out to defend the Court That Dark Money Built. https://t.co/btI6nVpUKq
Heading to the Senate floor again to discuss the Scheme by big Republican donor interests to capture our Supreme Court. Today, I cast the spotlight on ongoing Scheme operations.
What an honor to have the chance to visit with the legendary @WhipClyburn! https://t.co/Bw2KAdCm2p
Workers ought to have the right to organize for fair wages and working conditions, and congressional staff are no exception. I support staffers and other congressional employees’ efforts to unionize.

Ms. Naranjo should have gotten her day in court. Instead, the corporation that harmed her created a shell company which filed for bankruptcy, denying her the opportunity to receive timely compensation and provide for her family. Here is her story. https://t.co/zGKq7cXlVd

Mitch McConnell is right. We were there. It was a “violent insurrection for the purpose of trying to prevent the peaceful transfer of power.” Trump and RNC notion that this was “legitimate political discourse” is a lie.  
https://t.co/mX6NR0wy8L
Getting ready to host a virtual town hall at 6pm tonight. Rhode Islanders, sign up here to watch and send me a question: https://t.co/fk1SESJEKa
It’s big RI news that @RobertAWalshJr is retiring from @NEARhodeIsland. Few love the scrum of politics more than Bob, and few are better at it. I can’t wait for the next chapter.

Americans who have been harmed by corporations deserve justice, but a bankruptcy trick helps profitable companies dodge responsibility while their victims wait for compensation. Today’s hearing highlights these abuses and makes clear the need for reform. https://t.co/DjKvswjE9X

Once again, a Supreme Court all-Republican majority makes a political decision  (against the district court’s factual findings) that helps the Republican Party and dilutes Black citizens’ voting power. This is getting old.

No wonder Republicans won’t budge.

Transparency is way, way overdue.

Easy to repair: approve maps, with benefit of doubt to those drawn by bipartisan commissions.
Easy to spot: significant unexplained difference between statewide vote and delegation make-up (i.e. 50/50 and 13-5). Plus trial discovery showed redistricting mischief in plain view.

Here’s the truth: dark-money court packing is a project by right-wing donors. It’s supercharged by Republican justices and defended by Republicans in the Senate. If you don’t support ending dark money, you’ve lost all credibility to complain about it.

The industry could fix this, without great expense, but while it’s free to pollute, why bother? They spend the money instead on blocking climate progress in Congress.

In the long clash of civilizations, rule-of-law democracies must stand against kleptocrats & despots. That’s why I’m working to keep international criminals out of our financial system and enforce real transparency.

America needs solar panels for our clean energy transition, and tariffs are holding us back. I’m glad to see some restrictions eased, after my colleagues and I pushed for change, but we need to do more. The climate crisis doesn’t wait for anybody.
The real test? Who wants to get rid of the damned stuff (we do) and who defends it (they do). Watch my DISCLOSE Act.

Republicans created and defend dark money, then call us hypocrites when we play by their rules. They’d love it if we’d unilaterally disarm so they could pound us with dark money as they did for a decade.

Because God forbid the highly profitable fossil fuel industry should clean up its own mess. “Privatize profits; socialize costs” is corrupt business model.
https://t.co/esKMqHumTW
We can put astronauts on Moon. We can put rovers on Mars. Please don’t tell me we can’t put great new purpose-built EVs in USPS.

Les is one of Rhode Island’s great writers and great souls. Enjoy.   
https://t.co/tDQqs5k9z8

FedSoc gets him on Court, where he does FedSoc bidding, then pays back w private speech to big FedSoc donors. They’re not even trying to conceal #CapturedCourt.

Today is the 29th anniversary of the Family and Medical Leave Act, which protects Americans’ right to unpaid time off when they need it. Now, let’s pass permanent paid leave – that will help families and our economy alike.

Hey, you #ChamberofCarbon members who claim to support climate action, time to call off the Chamber dogs howling at her.
https://t.co/TPvwPcQKXW
America’s economy is making real progress. There is more to do, but this is a sign that our investments in this country and its workers are paying off. Let’s keep moving. https://t.co/JqA0eIFgJF
Best of luck to all our athletes in the 2022 Winter Olympic Games! As the ceremonies begin, I’m glad to see so many talented and hardworking Americans representing our country to the world.

Now, @judicialnetwork is pulling an old propaganda trick – accuse your opponent of what you, yourself, have done. These groups are rolling in dark money, but still try to tarnish Biden’s nominee — before she’s even named. Pay attention; it’s going to get ugly.

The Judicial Crisis Network is one of those groups. In 2016, they spent $7 million to attack Garland, and $10 million to boost Gorsuch.When it came to Barrett and Kavanaugh, they threw down a combined $20 million to launch media firestorms.

In 2011, the Supreme Court’s conservative justices opened the floodgates for dark money with Citizens United, allowing unlimited spending in our politics. Right away, a network of right-wing groups, donors, and non-profits sprung up and got to work.

Can we start with the fact that the Judicial Crisis Network is not even a real organization, but a “fictitious name” of another organization, one of several “fictitious names”? 

Throw in the secret donors, and it’s so gross it would gag a maggot.
The attack on Biden’s Supreme Court nominee has begun, spearheaded by the Judicial Crisis Network, and it all boils down to one thing: dark money.

Dark money groups like @judicialnetwork spent millions to capture the Supreme Court and ram conservative justices through the Senate. Now, they’re trying to paint Biden’s nominee as a puppet for big liberal donors. 

Sounds like misdirection to me.
We have a real failure happening in the plastics recycling market. https://t.co/BzRREjEoTs

As we dawdle, oceans warm and acidify and reefs die off. This is the price of deliberate fossil fuel industry political obstruction and interference. 
https://t.co/acCnFybcOC

Republican justices opened the door for unlimited dark money in Citizens United. 
 
Then, dark money groups spent hundreds of millions to vet and confirm a dark money supermajority on the Court.
 
Make no mistake, this scheme comes from big Republican donors. Full stop.

Almost a year ago, I delivered what I hoped would be my last Time to Wake Up speech on the need for climate action. Now, I’m headed back to the Senate floor to deliver another. Tune in soon.

We can’t stop now. Let's deliver for working families and make the expansion permanent.
Joining @allinwithchrishayes in a few minutes. Tune in!

Wishing my colleague @SenatorLujan a quick recovery. I’m very glad to hear he’s on the mend.
Congratulations on your retirement, @TomBrady. Nobody did it better.

During #BlackHistoryMonth, we recognize & honor the contributions of Black Americans. This is a time to commemorate remarkable individual achievements, recommit ourselves to the pursuit of equal justice, and reflect on our country's history.

Rhode Islanders deserve clean water in their homes & schools. That’s why we’re getting $378M from the bipartisan infrastructure law to boost our water infrastructure - it’s a much-needed investment in our health and well-being.
Dark money takes away voters' right to know who is talking to them and what's going on in their democracy.

Mercury poses serious health risks, and @EPA was right to reverse this irresponsible rule. Americans can breathe a little easier when their government sides with the people, not polluters.

We know that IRS budget cuts hurt honest taxpayers and help cheaters get off the hook. By properly funding the IRS, Congress can close those gaps and get Americans the service they deserve.
The bipartisan infrastructure plan is going to create good jobs, fix Rhode Island's roads & bridges, and improve access to clean water. Decades from now, these investments will still be paying off.
I’ll be live on @1a in a few minutes to discuss the Supreme Court and the road ahead. Tune in!

Soon, I’ll be speaking on the Senate floor to defend voting rights and push back against the tide of dark money in our politics.

A Reagan-appointed 1st Cir. judge said it well: it’s vital “that the electorate can understand who is speaking and, thus,to ‘give proper weight to different speakers and messages’ when deciding how to vote.” Dark money masks who is speaking.
We’re on the Senate floor today to strengthen the Voting Rights Act, get dark money out of our politics, and keep power in the hands of the people.
So it’s painful, and long, and you have to exhaust Republican speakers and table or stop dilatory motions and amendments, but you can get to a simple majority vote — eventually.
There can be a vote to overrule the call, which is debatable; but when that fails, whatever motion or amendment was ruled dilatory ends.

“Dilatory” motions, amendments and other delaying mischief can be ruled out of order by the presiding officer.  It takes a fair amount of nonsense before it becomes clearly dilatory, but it’s then a simple point of order—no vote.
The motion to table allows the Senate to clear the decks of amendments. Each requires a vote, but is not debatable. Week after week, even through weekends, table the bad amendments.

Another is the Senate speak-twice rule. Senators who’ve spoken twice on a question can be ruled out of order if they keep at it. That’s why real filibusters were long, uninterrupted speeches. Not one and done, but two and done.  (Yup, that’s 100 speeches by Rs — sorry!)

One is my DISCLOSE Act being in the bill.  Republicans must vote against it for their dark-money donors, but that kills them with voters. Ditto gerrymandering. Lots of focus on those painful votes for them in the bill will help.

Here’s the deal. Once Senate debate on a measure ends, you can pass the bill with a simple majority vote. So if you’re willing to outlast the other side, you don’t need cloture. This could take weeks, as other Voting Rights bills did, but we have a few tools that help.
